Overview.Summary: The 2022 Bulgarian parliamentary election was held on October 2, 2022 (2,8). The Central Election Commission announced the 240 candidates elected to the 48th National Assembly (1). GERB and the Socialist Party were the decisive winners of the elections (3,4). The first session of the National Assembly was attended by the Iraqi Ambassador (7). The official campaign period began on September 2 (8). The final outcome of the electoral process was the replacement of the Citizens for a European Development of Bulgaria/Grazhdani za evropeysko razvitie na Bulgaria (9). GERB topped the seven parties elected with 67 seats (10).

Timeline.Text: Bulgarians vote in the 2022 parliamentary election, with 240 candidates elected to the National Assembly.
The first session of the newly elected National Assembly is held, with GERB topping the seven parties represented.
The Bulgarian parliamentary election of 2009 is referenced as a comparison to the 2022 election.
The results of the 2022 parliamentary election are announced, with GERB winning 67 out of 240 seats.
The parliamentary elections are held over two rounds, on November 12 and November 19.

Overview.Summary: The 2022 Bulgarian parliamentary election is scheduled for October 2 (9). The election is expected to be a close race between the opposition Liberal party and the ruling GERB party (1,4). A major concern for the election is low voter turnout, which has previously resulted in invalidated results (1). The election will also be a test of support for the DPP ahead of presidential and parliamentary polls in early 2024 (6). Other countries, such as Kenya and Malaysia, have also recently held elections (2,5,7,10).

Timeline.Text: Kenya holds its general election, with four candidates vying for presidency and voters casting ballots for other positions.
The full results of Kenya's presidential and parliamentary races are announced.
Bulgaria's GERB party expands its lead ahead of Sunday's election.
Bulgaria holds early parliamentary elections.
Malaysia faces its first ever hung parliament after a tumultuous election.
Bulgaria's parliamentary election is updated on Alchetron.
Taiwan holds local elections as a key test for the ruling DPP party.

The election was held after the government approved a cost plan for the preparation and execution of the elections (3). The OSCE opened an election observation mission for the elections (9). 240 candidates were elected to the 48th National Assembly (1) and will be joined by four other political parties (8). The discussion of the elections can be found on the YouTube channel of IDM (5,8).

Overview.Summary: The 2022 Bulgarian parliamentary election (Event) resulted in a victory for the GERB party (Aspect) led by former Prime Minister Boyko Borissov (8). The election was held on October 2, 2022 (5,10) and was the fourth election in less than two years (8, 10). The provisional results showed that the ruling coalition lost its absolute majority in parliament (9). The election was observed by an international mission from the OSCE (4).

Timeline.Text: Bulgaria holds its early parliamentary elections.
The GERB party, led by former Prime Minister Boyko Borissov, is projected to win the election.
Brazilian President Lula congratulates GERB on their victory.
Results for the parliamentary elections are fully counted.

Overview.Summary: The 2022 Bulgarian parliamentary election took place on October 2, 2022 (1, 4, 8, 11, 12). The election resulted in a hung parliament, with no party winning a majority (4, 6, 16). The ruling coalition lost its absolute majority (15). The election was closely monitored by international observers (7). The election saw the electoral comeback of the centre-right GERB party (4, 12, 13). Voter turnout was low in some constituencies (2). The government did not attempt to influence the result (2). This was the fourth parliamentary election in less than two years (4, 16). The election was preceded by legislative elections in January 2021 (5). The election results were invalidated and a rerun was held due to low voter turnout (2). The approved funds for the election were BGN 70.5 (11). The election saw the establishment of a multi-party system in Kazakhstan (5). The election sparked debate about the cost of holding multiple elections in a short period of time (11, 20).

Timeline.Text: Bulgaria holds its fourth parliamentary election in 18 months.
GERB, led by former Prime Minister Boyko Borissov, is set to win the election according to preliminary results.
The election results in a hung parliament, with no party securing a majority.
Bulgaria's Central Election Commission officially announces the 240 candidates elected to the 48th National Assembly.
Bulgaria's electoral system is reformed in an attempt to develop a multi-party system.
The Socialist Party, in power before the election, comes in second place with around 18% of the vote.
The final results of the parliamentary elections are announced, with the GERB party declared the winner.
